See My Work

Projects

MHI Visit Days

View Project See Source Code

MHI Visit Days is a website I did for the University of Michigan School of Information Masters of Health Informatics program. First, I created and documented a design system for the layout and styles based off of the university's existing aesthetics. Then, I coded it to deliver their content in an organized, accessible, and functional way.

Task Manager

View Project See Source Code

TaskTonic task manager is a project that is still underway. It is a user-friendly app designed for people who need extra help and organization to complete tasks. It features an easy-to-use to-do list, a notes section, and uses various features to help motivate and aid users. These features include an innovative 'steps' tool, a prioritization system, tags and filters, and daily tips.

Envio Weather App

View Project See Source Code

Envio weather app is a responsive and accessible app which uses the OpenWeather API. It displays weather for the user's current location, and has a search feature to view the conditions of other places as well. Envio has many user-friendly features such as saving a home location, getting coordinates via geolocation, changing between metric and imperial units, dynamic icons and backgrounds, and more.

Calculator App

View Project See Source Code

quickCalc is a responsive calculator app with many useful features. It is fully compatible with screenreaders and equipt with keyboard shortcuts for each button. There are also 5 color themes to choose from, and the choice is saved locally for the next time you visit.
